msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; name of the donors; elements of the punctuation signs, of the text dividers and of the quire marks; elements of Ethiopic numerals. Several groups of lines on the incipit page of Text I-1, alternating with black lines; initial two lines of Texts I-3, II, III, IV and subsections of Texts I-1 and I-4; two groups of lines on the incipit page of Text I-2, alternating with black lines; two lines of the poems following miracles 4, 6 and 7.

msItem.note: - Halle luya nǝsäggǝd lä-ʾab bǝrhanat wä-lä-wäldu waḥǝd… “Halleluiah, we worship the Father…” (fols. 9rb-10ra)
- ʾƎsäggǝd läki ʾo-ʾǝgzǝʾtǝnä Maryam qǝddǝst dǝngǝl ʾǝmmu lä-ʾIyäsus Krǝstos kähali… “I worship you, o my Lady, Holy Virgin Mary, mother of Jesus Christ the Almighty…” (fols. 10vb-11ra)
- Sälam läki ʾo-ʾǝgzǝʾtǝnä Maryam dǝngǝl ʾǝmmä mädḫǝn ʾǝmmä bǝrhan … “Salutation to you, o my Lady, Virgin Mary, Mother of the Saviour and Mother of the Light…” (fols. 11ra-12ra).
All miracles of Mary (Text I-4) are numbered. Miracles 4, 6 and 7 are followed by a poem:
ታቦተ፡ አምላከ፡ ፳ኤል፡ ጽዮን፡ ማርያም፡ ዘነገደት፡ ምድረ፡ ኢሎፍሊ።
አመ፡ ነገደት፡ ቍስቋመ፡ በኃይለ፡ ወልዳ፡ ከሃሊ።
ወድቁ፡ አማልክተ፡ ግብጽ፡ መናብርተ፡ ሰይጣን፡ ሀባሊ።
እስከ፡ መነነቶ፡ ሚልኮል፡ ቅድመ፡ ታቦተ፡ ሕግ፡ አመ፡ ዘፈነ።
ቅድመ፡ ገጸ፡ ሥዕልኪ፡ ድንግል፡ ዘዕዘፍን፡ አነ።
(= a strophe from the Maḫletä ṣǝge "Canticle of the Flower", cp. GrohHymn p. 82).
(= a strophe from the Maḫletä ṣǝge "Canticle of the Flower", cp. GrohHymn p. 78).

Fol. 107r: Sale note (?). Fol. 107r: ፲፱፻፴፩ዓመተ፡ ምሕረት፡ ፳፫ቀን፡ እኔ፡ አብርሃ፡ ለ፷፪ብር፡ ሸጤ፡ አሎኩ፡ ስሸጥ፡ የነበረ፡ አማኞች፡ … ጊዮርጊስ፡ ወልደ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ … መምሕር፡ ወልደ፡ ሚካኤል፡ … ወልደ፡ ገሪማ፡
The note is crudely written in pencil and it is barely legible. It is written in Amharic, is dated 1931 year of mercy (= 1938/39 AD) and mentions several individuals: ʾAbrǝha, Giyorgis Wäldä ʾIyäsus, mämḥǝr Wäldä Mikaʾel, Wäldä Gärima. It concludes with ʾAbrǝha’s fingerprint.

- A devotional image of European origin is sewn on fol. 4v. - The scribe reduced the size of his handwriting: fols. 9rb-10ra. - Omitted letters written interlineally in the main hand: e.g., fols. 15vb, 47va, 70ra, 97rb. - Omitted letters or words inserted interlineally in small script in a secondary hand: fols. 11va, 12rb. - Omitted letters added at the end of the line in a recent secondary hand in blue pen: fols. 104va, 106ra. - Correction written over erasures in the main hand: fol. 91vb. - Erasures: e.g., fols. 10rb, 14vb, 17va, 35rb. - Erasures marked with thin red lines: fols. 44va, 67rb, 87ra, 94ra. - Lacunae (spaces for rubricated names left unfilled) on many leaves: e.g., fols. 21vb, 26rb, 29vb, 42ra, 70vb, 92vb, 106va.

person.persName: The name of Śärṣä Śǝllase is written in the main hand (hand a) in the supplication formula on fol. 61rb. The name of Wälättä Yoḥannǝs is crudely written in a recent secondary hand in deep crimson ink in the supplication formulas of Text I: e.g., fols. 14vb, 20rb, 59vb, 73vb, 98va. Names of her relatives are also crudely inserted in a recent secondary hand, in deep crimson ink, in the supplication formulas of Text I: ʾabuyä Gäbrä Tǝnsaʾe (fols. 55ra, 56rb, 59rb), ʾabuyä Gäbrä Mäsqäl (e.g., fols. 56vb, 101vb, 105rb), ʾabuyä Wäl(d)ä Gärima (fols. 57rb, 97rb, 101ra, 102ra), Wälättä Giwärgis (sic) (fols. 99ra, 100rb), ʾuhuyä (sic) Gä(b)rä Ṣadǝq (fol. 47ra). Gäbrä Tǝnsaʾe is written in the main hand (hand b) in the supplication formulas of Texts II-IV: fols. 105ra, 105vb, 106ra, 106rb. The name of ʾabuyä Gäbrä Mäsqäl is written in hand b in the supplication formula of Text II on fol. 105rb.
